intro: Townsendia condensata, commonly known as the denseflower tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dense, clustered inflorescence of yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss, while its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Townsendia condensata is often found in open habitats like grasslands and rocky slopes, where it thrives in full sun.
